snippet: The police said that as Reynaldo Cuevas, 20, fled a robbery in progress at the bodega where he worked in the Bronx, he was accidentally and fatally shot when he collided with an officer.
abstract: Bronx bodega worker Reynaldo Cuevas is killed by the accidental discharge of a New York City Police Officer's gun when he collides with the officer in a frightened haste to escape armed robbers who had forced their way into the store; Cueva's killing is the third high-profile fatal police shooting in New York City in four weeks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Daniel Krieger, Colin Moynihan, Wendy Ruderman and Nate Schweber.

lead_paragraph: The police said that as Reynaldo Cuevas, 20, fled a robbery in progress at the bodega where he worked in the Bronx, he was accidentally and fatally shot when he collided with an officer.

headline.seo: Police Bullet Kills Bronx Bodega Worker Fleeing Robbery
headline.main: Just After Closing Time, a Fatal Split Second
headline.print_headline: Just After Closing Time, a Fatal Split Second
